lines.content: Duke is a task manager to help users manage personal tasks, including events, deadlines, and todo tasks.
Add a `event`, `todo`, or `deadline` task to the task list.
You can mark a task as done if you finish this task.
You can see all the tasks you have currently.
You can delete tasks from the tasks you have currently.
You can find tasks with certain keywords from all the tasks you have currently.
When you open Duke, the tasks stored in a local file `duke.txt` will be loaded automatically. If the file does not exist, Duke will create a new local file `duke.txt`.
When you make changes to the tasks list, the changes will be saved into a local file `duke.txt` automatically.
You can use `bye` to exit Duke.
Enter `event` task with a description and its date/time to add an event task.
Enter `\at` between the description and date/time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list
Enter `todo` task with a description to add a todo task.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list
Enter a `deadline` task with a description and its due date/time to add a deadline event.
Enter `\by` between the description and due date/time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list
Enter `done` with an index number to mark the task with the index in the tasks list as done.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Enter `list` to see all the tasks.
Enter `delete` with an index number to delete the task with this index.
Now you have 2 items in the list.
### `find` - Find the tasks with a keyword
Enter `find` with a keyword to see all the tasks that contain this keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Enter `bye` command to print goodbye message and exit Duke.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
* A task manager to manage tasks including deadlines, todos, and events.
* It has functions like add tasks, delete tasks, mark a task as done,
* list all tasks, and find tasks you have with specific keywords.
* @param filePath the path of the file to store and restore the tasks information
* Main program to start the application.
* Initialise a Duck object and run it.
* A constructor to initialise a parser with command.
* Parse command to get the behavior.
System.out.println("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description cannot be empty or invalid.\n");
* Set the user input date from a string to a meaningful date.
* @return string of a meaningful date if the input is in "MMM d yyyy" format,
* Save the information of all the tasks to the file.
* @param tasks task list contains all the information about the tasks
* Load all the information about tasks to the file
* @param tasks the task list to load the the information to
* An instructor to initialise an empty array list for tasks.
* Add a task to the task list.
* @param task the task to be added to the task list
* Delete a task from the task list.
* @param command the delete command with the index of the task to be deleted
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " items in the list.\n");
* Get all the current tasks in the task list.
* Print all the tasks in the task list.
* Mark the status of the task as done.
* @param command the done command with the index of the task to be mark as done
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Add a todo task to the tasks list.
* @param command the todo command with the description of the todo task
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list");
* Add a event task to the task list.
* @param command the event command with the description and the date and time of the event task
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list");
* Add a deadline task to the task list.
* @param command the deadline command with the description and deadline of the deadline task
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list");
* @param command command string from user input
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Welcome users when the program starts.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?\n");
* Say goodbye to users before exits when the program ends.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!\n");
* Get user inputs and deal with the commands.
* Update the information about tasks on task list and the file once the information of tasks changes.
* @param tasks taskList contains all the information about current tasks.
* A constructor of the deadline task
* @param description the String description of the task
* @param by the deadline of the task
* Change the format of the deadline task to save in the file
* @return the String to be saved in file
* A constructor of the event task
* @param description the String description of the task
* @param at the date and time of the task
* Change the format of the event task to save in the file
* @return the String to be saved in file
* A constructor of a task with description.
* Get the description of the task
* Set the state of the task
* @param isDone the status of the task
* Change the format of the task to save in the file
* @return the String to be saved in file
* Print the information of the task in a format
* @return the string contains the information of the task
* A instructor of a todo task
* @param description the description of the task
* Change the format of todo task to save into the file
* @return the String to be saved in file
